Label: Narrative
Text: The MOVING reference member state of this VC (Value Chain) is CZECH REPUBLIC. The reference MOVING Card ID of this VC is VC 15 CZ. Syrup producers are not necessarily located in mountain areas. They collect ingredients from the mountain region and process the ingredients in nearby regions. Crucial part of the VC is the marketing that utilizes symbolic value of the region. There are examples of producers that organize their businesses as a social interprise with additional positive impacts in social areas.   The reference mountain chain of this VC is Sumava - Cesky les. The reference mountain landscape of this VC is LAU 1 Trutnov. LAU 1 - Trutnov is the largest district within the NUTS 3 Kralovehradecky. The landscape of the region is very diverse with large differences in altitude. Such landscape makes the region less favorable for agricultural activities. 43,2% of the region covers agricultural land. Approximately a half of the agricultural land is arable land (53%). There is also a high share of perennial grassland in the region (41,6%). Forest land covers 46,9% of the region and this is the highest share within the NUTS2. The region includes the highest mountains of the Czech Republic (Giant Mountains) with the highest peak 1602 meters above s.l. The area of the mountains inlcude the National Park (with 385 km2).   The size of the area (km2) is 1146.78. The minimum altimetry of the LAU (Local Administrative Unit) is 263. The maximum altimetry of the LAU is 1603. The total population (in thousand) is 117.978. The population density (Inhabitants/km2) in the LAU is 102.87. The population change rate of the LAU in the last 10 years (%) has been -1.84%. The overall regional population density (Inhabitants/km2) is 121.79. The regional population change rate in the last 10 years (%) has been 0.44%.   The average per capita income (EUR/year) [Province] is 10130.69. The total Gross Value Added (GVA) (EUR million/year) [Province] is 9173.35. The primary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 4.50%. The secondary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 40.50%. The tertiary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 55.10%. The per capita income (EUR/year) [Region] is 9762.62. The total Gross Value Added (GVA) (EUR million/year) [Region] is 23148.69. The primary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 3.29%. The secondary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 46.85%. The tertiary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 49.90%.   The total number of bed places (BPs) in tourist accommodations/year in the LAU (Local Administrative Unit) is 55419. The regional (Region) share of total BPs/year is 0.45%. The number of agricultural holdings in the LAU is 1759. The nearest settlement with population over 100000 (km) is 100. In this region protected areas are present.   The primary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 5.41%. The secondary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 39.27%. The tertiary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 55.33%. The primary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 3.80%. The secondary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 59.94%. The tertiary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 36.26%.   The VC aims on production of syrups of various flavours. The syrups are presented as a regional product that uses herbs and fruits collected in mountains. It also refers to traditonal recipes for preparing the syrups. Alhough this product is not unique of mountain regions, it is a great example of utilizing natural and symbolic values associated with the region. In order to generate an unique selling proposition, the syrups are often marketing as a special regional product.   More important than the natural assets (that can be fairly easily substituted) is the social construction of quality that is used in marketing. For this purpose the producers refer to traditional knowledge embedded in the region, their product labels refer to cultural traits associated with the mountain area. The symbolic value refering to the mountains is what distingusihes the product from other similar products.    Syrups are sold on mainstream food markets that are highly competetive. Main challenge for the given VC is associated with valorization of the product and with a marketing strategy. Overall the type of challenge faced by this VC is Current. This VC is classified as Traditional.   The type of innovation of this VC (Value Chain) is unspecified. The innovation is related to the whole VC. The land use systems involved are Natural land. The local assets include Natural and cultural.   The VC is not so important in terms of the use of natural (tangible) resources, but it is a typical example of the VC that is embedded in mountain region, but uses the intangible resources of the region.
